For example, EGR technology could potentially make geothermal power production cost-effective even in areas with low-temperature reservoirs. The use of advanced geothermal power cycles has already shown to increase the efficiency of geothermal power plants and reduce their operating costs.

In the long term, as natural gas becomes more expensive and renewable energy sources become more competitive, geothermal energy will likely become a more attractive option, especially in areas with favorable geothermal resources. However, the initial costs of geothermal exploration and development can still be high, which may limit its widespread adoption in the short term.
